intro: Capsella helsingica, commonly known as the Helsingönskapsella, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many common garden plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Capsella helsingica is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
